intro: Adenocline sessilifolia, commonly known as the sessile-leaf adenocline, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its simple, sessile leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Adenocline sessilifolia is noted for its ecological importance as a food source for various pollinators and small herbivores.
